meanings.definition: To make someone extremely angry or impatient.
meanings.sent1: When my brother hides my toys, it infuriates me.
meanings.sent2: The constant noise from the construction site infuriates the neighbors.
meanings.sent3: It infuriates me when my cat pretends not to hear me calling her for dinner.
meanings.sent4: The unfair treatment of employees by the boss infuriates the workers.
meanings.sent5: The slow internet connection always infuriates me when I'm trying to stream a movie.

meanings.sent1: His teasing remarks always infuriate his little sister.
meanings.sent2: The rude customer's behavior infuriated the store manager.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy's antics never fail to infuriate the older dog.
meanings.sent4: The politician's controversial statements infuriated many voters.
meanings.sent5: The constant interruptions during the meeting infuriated the presenter.
